TopicTitle: CCP Games to send EVE Online player's names into space.

Articles.Content:
At Wednesday May 9th at 12:00 GMT CCP games will launch the names of EVE Online players into space via high altitude balloon. 

The launch with help of the students of the University of ReykjavÃ­k

Mission tracking with streaming video via a Samsung Note with 3G

Additional mission video 3 on-board GoPro cameras

Last but not least vehicle recovery the Icelandic Coast Guard

Follow at

[http://www.ccpgames.com/skywardsphere](http://www.ccpgames.com/skywardsphere)

Ehh, unless the balloon goes over 100km, I wouldn\'t call it space. 

But for publicity, it\'s 

![CloseEnough.png](http://i1099.photobucket.com/albums/g388/nghia_vn/Meme/CloseEnough.png)

In the blog they do say 'stratosphere'. It\'s up now, and there is a live tracker and a blog feed, as well as a twitter tag. Can\'t be bothered to retype, it\'s all in this post on MCV Nordic: 

[http://www.mcvnordic.com/news/read/right-now-ccp-space-launch/095752](http://www.mcvnordic.com/news/read/right-now-ccp-space-launch/095752)
In space? liars. Its NEAR SPACE!!
Define 'names of EVE Online players'. Does that mean a plaque, paper, or a flash drive with a text document on it?
I\'m guessing a CD with a .txt, but that\'s no fun! If I were doing this, I\'d broadcast the names as a radio signal heading for a random star or something.

> 
> I\'m guessing a CD with a .txt, but that\'s no fun! If I were doing this, I\'d broadcast the names as a radio signal heading for a random star or something.

That is a better idea because then at least the names are 'In' space
Okay, it\'s near space. It is just my real name, character names, and character avatars pics in a document form. It is still pretty cool to me.

So...does it just sit there or does it pop and come back down?...

Seriously what a waste of materials. A radio broadcast would have been way better

I played EVE over a satellite connection when I used to live in a rural area with no broadband.

So, my name went into space all the time. I am underwhelmed. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

The Balloon popped, parachuted back to earth, was recovered by Icelandic Coast Guard then the ship model and tablet will be sold to raise money for charity.

And as for a waste of money: It gave college students a chance to fulfill a real world mission during their education. I think it was totally worth the money CCP spent. Who say CCP is going to leave it here. It was fun for them so they may try something even more spectacular latter.
